info.name: DurgasOS API
info.description:
Complete API collection for DurgasOS Backend - FastAPI application with modular architecture.

## Setup Instructions
1. Import the Development environment file
2. Update environment variables if needed (base_url, etc.)
3. Start the backend server: `uvicorn app.main:app --reload`
4. All endpoints use the base URL: `{{base_url}}/api/v1`

## Modules
- **Gemini**: AI chat, image/video generation, transcription, TTS
- **Files**: File management (list, upload, delete)
- **Settings**: Application settings management
- **Vector**: Vector database operations
- **Desktop**: Desktop state management
- **WebSocket**: Real-time notifications

item.name: Root

request.description: Root endpoint that returns API information and version.

exec: pm.test("Response has message and version", function () {

request.description: Health check endpoint to verify API server status.

item.description: Root endpoints for API information and health checks.

item.name: Gemini

request.description:
Chat endpoint for AI conversations using Gemini models.

**Request Body:**
- `history`: Array of previous chat messages (role: 'user' or 'assistant', text: message content)
- `message`: Current user message
- `model`: Model to use (default: 'gemini-3-pro-preview')
- `use_thinking`: Enable thinking mode (optional, default: false)
- `use_grounding`: Enable grounding mode (optional, default: false)

**Response:**
- `text`: AI response text
- `grounding_metadata`: Optional grounding metadata if enabled

Generate images using AI based on text prompts.

**Request Body:**
- `prompt`: Text description of the image to generate (required)
- `aspect_ratio`: Image aspect ratio (optional, default: '1:1')
- `is_hq`: High quality flag (optional, default: false)

**Response:**
- `images`: Array of generated image URLs or base64 strings

Generate videos using AI based on text prompts.

**Request Body:**
- `prompt`: Text description of the video to generate (required)
- `aspect_ratio`: Video aspect ratio (optional, default: '16:9')
- `image_base64`: Optional base64 encoded image to use as starting frame

**Response:**
- `video_url`: URL or path to the generated video

Transcribe audio to text using AI.

**Request Body:**
- `audio_base64`: Base64 encoded audio data (required)
- `mime_type`: Audio MIME type (optional, default: 'audio/mp3')

**Response:**
- `text`: Transcribed text from the audio

Convert text to speech audio.

**Request Body:**
- `text`: Text to convert to speech (required)

**Response:**
- `audio_base64`: Base64 encoded audio data

item.description: Gemini AI module endpoints for chat, image/video generation, transcription, and text-to-speech.

item.name: Files

request.description:
List files and directories in the specified parent directory.

**Query Parameters:**
- `parent_id`: Parent directory ID (optional, default: 'c_drive')

**Response:**
- `files`: Array of file items with id, name, type, size, date_modified, parent_id

Upload a file to the specified parent directory.

**Form Data:**
- `file`: File to upload (required)
- `parent_id`: Parent directory ID (optional, default: 'c_drive')

**Response:**
- `file_id`: ID of the uploaded file
- `filename`: Name of the uploaded file
- `size`: Size of the file in bytes

exec: pm.test("Response has file_id and filename", function () {

variable.description: ID of the file to delete

request.description:
Delete a file by its ID.

**Path Parameters:**
- `file_id`: ID of the file to delete (required)

**Response:**
- `success`: Boolean indicating if deletion was successful

item.description: File management endpoints for listing, uploading, and deleting files.

request.description:
Get all application settings.

**Response:**
- `settings`: Dictionary of all settings (key-value pairs)

Update a specific setting.

**Request Body:**
- `key`: Setting key name (required)
- `value`: Setting value - can be string, number, boolean, or object (required)

**Response:**
- `success`: Boolean indicating if update was successful

**Example Settings:**
- `theme`: 'light' or 'dark'
- `language`: Language code
- `notifications_enabled`: true/false

item.name: Vector

request.description:
Search the vector database for similar documents.

**Request Body:**
- `query`: Search query text (required)
- `n_results`: Number of results to return (optional, default: 5)

**Response:**
- `results`: Array of search results with document content and metadata

Add documents to the vector database for semantic search.

**Request Body:**
- `documents`: Array of document texts to add (required)
- `ids`: Optional array of unique IDs for each document
- `metadatas`: Optional array of metadata objects for each document

**Response:**
- Success confirmation with document IDs

item.description: Vector database operations for semantic search and document storage.

item.name: Desktop

request.description:
Get the current desktop state including all window positions and states.

**Query Parameters:**
- `user_id`: User ID (optional, default: 'default')

**Response:**
- `windows`: Array of window state objects with id, app_id, title, is_open, is_minimized, is_maximized, z_index, position, size

Save the desktop state including all window positions and states.

**Query Parameters:**
- `user_id`: User ID (optional, default: 'default')

**Request Body:**
- `windows`: Array of window state objects, each containing:
  - `id`: Window ID (required)
  - `app_id`: Application ID (required)
  - `title`: Window title (required)
  - `is_open`: Whether window is open (required)
  - `is_minimized`: Whether window is minimized (required)
  - `is_maximized`: Whether window is maximized (required)
  - `z_index`: Z-index for window layering (required)
  - `position`: Object with x, y coordinates (required)
  - `size`: Object with width, height (required)

**Response:**
- `success`: Boolean indicating if save was successful

item.description: Desktop state management endpoints for saving and retrieving window configurations.

item.name: WebSocket

request.description:
WebSocket endpoint for real-time notifications.

**Connection URL:** `{{ws_url}}` (typically `ws://localhost:8000/ws`)

**Message Format:**
To send a notification, send a JSON message:
```json
{
    "type": "send_notification",
    "data": {
        "title": "Notification Title",
        "message": "Notification message content",
        "app_name": "App Name" (optional),
        "duration": 5000 (optional, milliseconds)
    }
}
```

**Note:** Postman supports WebSocket connections. Use the WebSocket request type to connect.

**Example Messages:**
1. **Connection Test:** Just connect to verify the WebSocket is working
2. **Send Notification:**
```json
{
    "type": "send_notification",
    "data": {
        "title": "New Message",
        "message": "You have a new message",
        "app_name": "Messenger",
        "duration": 5000
    }
}
```

item.description: WebSocket endpoint for real-time notifications. Connect to receive and send notification messages.
